subject: The London Perl Workshop

entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.title: NICEPERL's lists
entries.text: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

entries.author: yanick_champoux
entries.title: Happy Taskgiving
entries.text: Yanick has released some new commands for his tool for TaskWarrior.
The weekly round-up of P5P notes, which includes links to a lot of grant updates from Dave and Zefram.
entries.author: sawyer_x
entries.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: November 13th to 20th

entries.author: flavio_glock
entries.title: Perl5 as a first-class script engine in Java
entries.text: An update from Fl√°vio on Perlito, an implementation of Perl 5 that runs in the JVM. You can now run Perl scripts from inside a Java application.
Jeff takes us through testing in Perl 6.
entries.author: jeff_goff
entries.title: Test All The Things

entries.text: The weekly roundup of Rakudo news, with links to a videos for Perl 6 talks from TPCiA.
entries.title: 2017.47 More TPCiA Videos
entries.author: liztormato

entries.title: A unified and improved Supply concurrency model
entries.author: jonathan_worthington
entries.text: Jonathan describes his recent work to improve the concurrency features provided by Supply.

entries.author: mark_keating
entries.title: London Perl Workshop is Amazing
entries.text: It was great seeing Mark at LPW, throughly enjoying being an attendee, and that shines through in this post as well.

Lance gave a tutorial on the Bailador web framework for Perl 6, and shares this thoughts on how that went, along with the rest of the day. I loved this line: "It was just so darn friendly, and the whole darn Perl community is so darn friendly".
entries.title: Lance Wicks's report on LPW
entries.author: lance_wicks

entries.text: JJ's thoughts on the day, during which he gave a talk on using Perl 6 for teaching programming to complete novices.
entries.author: jj_merelo
entries.title: The Lion and the Butterfly and the Camel

entries.text: Mohammad gave his first-ever Perl talk last year at LPW, and he came back to talk about Map::Tube this year.
entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.title: Mohammad's report on LPW

entries.text: Alberto passes on an update from Chad, for his work on Test2, being done under a TPD grant.
entries.title: Test2 Documentation Grant Progress Report
entries.author: alberto_simoes

entries.title: PullRequest - Personal Milestone
entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Mohammad has got addicted to help others, via pull requests. He gives us some statistics on his journey so far.

header:
The London Perl Workshop was on Saturday, and we've already had four blog posts about it.
You'll pick up on a theme: it was a great community event.

There are a lot more TPCiA videos online now,
and the Perl 6 weekly news has links to those about Perl 6.
